intro: Hoffmannseggella pfisteri, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hoffmannseggella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Central America, it thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
